datafield.subfield: First Congregational Society at the Head of the Acushnet River (Acushnet, Mass.)
Church of Christ in Dartmouth (Acushnet, Mass.)
NUCMC data from Old Dartmouth Historical Society Whaling Museum Library for First Unitarian Church. Records, 1730-1977

(First Congregational Society at the head of the Acushnet River; Acushnet, Mass.; organized ca. 1708; later church built in New Bedford; in ca. 1795 group of more liberal members split off to form First Congregational Society, New Bedford; this later (1956) became First Unitarian Church; also appears: First Congregational Society)

p. 44, etc. (first Puritan or Congregational church built in Acushnet 1708; later church built in New Bedford; in 1796 more liberal members split off to form First Congregational Society (New Bedford) which later became First Unitarian Church)
p. 61, etc. (First Congregational Society at the Head of the Acushnet River)
NUCMC data from Congl. Library for First Congregational Society (New Bedford, Mass.). Records, 1814
(gathered 1708 as Church of Christ in Dartmouth, at Acushnet or "the head of the river" Mass; in 1795 new meeting house built at New Bedford)
